content:
Imagine you are a robot browsing the web, just like humans. Now you need to complete a task. In each iteration, you will receive an Observation that includes a screenshot of a webpage and some texts. This screenshot will feature Numerical Labels placed in the TOP LEFT corner of each Web Element.
Carefully analyze the visual information to identify the Numerical Label corresponding to the Web Element that requires interaction, then follow the guidelines and choose one of the following actions:
1. Click a Web Element.
2. Delete existing content in a textbox and then type content. 
3. Scroll up or down. Multiple scrolls are allowed to browse the webpage. Pay attention!! The default scroll is the whole window. If the scroll widget is located in a certain area of the webpage, then you have to specify a Web Element in that area. I would hover the mouse there and then scroll.
4. Wait. Typically used to wait for unfinished webpage processes, with a duration of 5 seconds.
5. Go back, returning to the previous webpage.
6. Google, directly jump to the Google search page. When you can't find information in some websites, try starting over with Google.
7. Answer. This action should only be chosen when all questions in the task have been solved.

Correspondingly, Action should STRICTLY follow the format:
- Click [Numerical_Label]
- Type [Numerical_Label]; [Content]
- Scroll [Numerical_Label or WINDOW]; [up or down]
- Wait
- GoBack
- Google
- ANSWER; [content]

Key Guidelines You MUST follow:
* Action guidelines *
1) To input text, NO need to click textbox first, directly type content. After typing, the system automatically hits `ENTER` key. Sometimes you should click the search button to apply search filters. Try to use simple language when searching.  
2) You must Distinguish between textbox and search button, don't type content into the button! If no textbox is found, you may need to click the search button first before the textbox is displayed. 
3) Execute only one action per iteration. 
4) STRICTLY Avoid repeating the same action if the webpage remains unchanged. You may have selected the wrong web element or numerical label. Continuous use of the Wait is also NOT allowed.
5) When a complex Task involves multiple questions or steps, select "ANSWER" only at the very end, after addressing all of these questions (steps). Flexibly combine your own abilities with the information in the web page. Double check the formatting requirements in the task when ANSWER. 
* Web Browsing Guidelines *
1) Don't interact with useless web elements like Login, Sign-in, donation that appear in Webpages. Pay attention to Key Web Elements like search textbox and menu.
2) Vsit video websites like YouTube is allowed BUT you can't play videos. Clicking to download PDF is allowed and will be analyzed by the Assistant API.
3) Focus on the numerical labels in the TOP LEFT corner of each rectangle (element). Ensure you don't mix them up with other numbers (e.g. Calendar) on the page.
4) Focus on the date in task, you must look for results that match the date. It may be necessary to find the correct year, month and day at calendar.
5) Pay attention to the filter and sort functions on the page, which, combined with scroll, can help you solve conditions like 'highest', 'cheapest', 'lowest', 'earliest', etc. Try your best to find the answer that best fits the task.

Your reply should strictly follow the format:
Thought: {Your brief thoughts (briefly summarize the info that will help ANSWER)}
Action: {One Action format you choose}
Confidence: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating your confidence level in the action. A higher value means greater confidence.}
Completion: {A float between 0 and 1 indicating how much of the task has been completed until now. Zero means no progress has been made and one means full completion.}

Then the User will provide:
Observation: {A labeled screenshot Given by User}

Now given a task: Look for an English language book on roman empire history in the Amazon Kindle store. Sort by newests arrivals and look for a title that will be released within a month.  Please interact with https://www.amazon.com/ and get the answer.Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To begin the search for an English language book on Roman Empire history in the Amazon Kindle store, I need to use the search bar at the top of the page. The textbox for inputting a search query is labeled [1].
Action: Type [1]; roman empire history kindle
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.1
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To refine the results to only Kindle books, I should select the "Kindle Store" or "Kindle eBooks" department on the left. Sorting the results by newest arrivals comes next, but filtering for English language books might help too. First, I'll click "Kindle eBooks" to focus on Kindle titles.
Action: Click [35]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.2
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: To meet the task requirements, I now need to sort the Kindle eBooks results by "Newest Arrivals" to find new and upcoming releases. I should use the sorting dropdown next.
Action: Click [19]
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.3
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The sorting dropdown is now open, and "Publication Date" will sort by the newest arrivals, which is what the task requires. I should select this option.
Action: Click [57]
Confidence: 0.98
Completion: 0.45
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The results are now sorted by "Publication Date." I need to check the titles for a release date within a month. The current top result does not show a future release date on this screen, so I may need to check further details by clicking the title of the first book.
Action: Click [21]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The current Kindle book listing ("Ancient Rome: An Enthralling Overview...") shows as "Available instantly," meaning it is already released and not one that will be released within a month. I need to go back to the previous results page and check the next title for its release status.
Action: GoBack
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.6
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The first book does not meet the requirement since it is already available. The next result is "The Romans: A Captivating Guide to the People, Emperors, Soldiers and Gladiators of Ancient Rome...". I should click its title to check whether it will be released within a month.
Action: Click [31]
Confidence: 0.95
Completion: 0.7
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The displayed page is for a series called "The Ancient Romans (11 books)" by Captivating History. The release or availability information for the Kindle editions is not visible. I need to scroll down to find detailed publication or release dates for each book in the series to determine if any is due for release within a month.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.8
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The first book in the series, "The Roman Games: A Captivating Guide to the Gladiators, Chariot Races, and Games in Ancient Rome," was released on July 4, 2021, which is not within a month from now. I need to check other books in the series for their release dates, so I should continue scrolling down.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.85
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The second book, "The Romans: A Captivating Guide to the People, Emperors, Soldiers and Gladiators of Ancient Rome..." was released on April 26, 2021, which is in the past. The next title below is "Pompeii: A Captivating Guide to the City in Ancient Rome That Was Buried Because of the Eruption..." but I cannot see its release date yet. I need to continue scrolling to look for any future releases within a month.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.87
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The book "Pompeii: A Captivating Guide to the City in Ancient Rome..." was released on June 25, 2021, which is not within the upcoming month. The next book, "The Roman Republic: A Captivating Guide to the Rise and Fall..." has a release date of May 24, 2018, so it is also not relevant. None of the displayed books match the requirement to be released within a month. I need to continue scrolling to see if there are any titles with an upcoming release date.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.89
Observation: A screenshot and some texts. (Omitted in context.)

Thought: The book "The Roman Empire: A Captivating Guide to the Rise and Fall of the Roman Empire..." was released on May 1, 2018, so it is not a new release. None of the displayed books fit the requirement of being released within a month. I should continue scrolling to look for any upcoming releases.
Action: Scroll WINDOW; down
Confidence: 0.97
Completion: 0.91
